choices.text: Punched out appearance of interdental papilla

questions.text: Which of the following is true about Acute Necrotizing Ulcerative Gingivitis (ANUG)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Punched out appearance of interdental papilla

Acute Necrotizing Ulcerative Gingivitis:

• Also called Vincent's disease, trench mouth & fusospirochaetal infection.

• Seasonal variation seen; affects young adults.

Clinical Findings:

• Punched out, crater like depressions at the crest of interdental papillae.

• May extend to marginal gingiva but rarely to attached gingiva and oral mucosa.

• Ulcers are covered by grey, pseudomembranous slough which is demarcated from the remaining gingival mucosa by a pronounced linear erythema.

• Spontaneous and pronounced bleeding, fetid odour seen.

• Metallic foul taste and increased salivation.

• Occurs in all ages but highest incidence is 15-36 years

• ANUG is transmissible but not communicable:

• ANUG can occur in otherwise disease-free mouths or can be superimposed on chronic gingivitis or periodontal pockets.

All of the above

A prisoner is found dead in a locked room with a towel tightly wrapped around his neck. Autopsy shows a deep horizontal ligature mark with no fracture of hyoid. The likely cause is:
A man is shot in the chest. The entry wound has blackening, tattooing, and a circular abrasion collar. The probable distance of fire is:
A pedestrian hit by a car presents with tibial fractures, pelvic injuries, and skull trauma. What is the most likely injury pattern?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Waddell’s Triad consists of three primary injuries:

1. Femoral Fracture: Usually caused by the vehicle’s direct impact on the child’s leg.

2. Intra-abdominal or intrathoracic injury includes damage to internal organs such as the liver, spleen, or lungs - Usually by the secondary impact of the body against the ground or other objects.

3. Head Injury: This can range from mild concussions to severe traumatic brain injuries (TBI). The head injury results from the child being thrown to the ground or hitting a hard surface.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, hematemesis, and black tarry stools. He accidentally ingested a chemical used for toilet cleaning.
